description: This TRAP is generated when a Layer-2 Tunnel
is created.
This object contains the local tunnel Identifier.
variables.name: L2TV1-MIB::l2tTunnelLocalTunnelControlId

description: The type of Layer-2 Tunnel. Possible values are:
1 = Layer-2 Tunnel Protocol Tunnel
2 = Layer-2 Forwarding Tunnel
3 = Point-to-Point Tunnel Protocol Tunnel.
variables.name: L2TV1-MIB::l2tTunnelType

description: This TRAP is generated when a Layer-2 Tunnel
ends.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD L2TV1-MIB::l2tTunnelStop L2TV1-MIB::l2tTunnelLocalTunnelControlId i 9999 L2TV1-MIB::l2tTunnelType i 1 L2TV1-MIB::l2tTunnelUpTime t 31536000

description: This object contains the local tunnel Identifier.
variables.name: L2TV1-MIB::l2tTunnelLocalTunnelControlId

description: The type of Layer-2 Tunnel. Possible values are:
1 = Layer-2 Tunnel Protocol Tunnel
2 = Layer-2 Forwarding Tunnel
3 = Point-to-Point Tunnel Protocol Tunnel.
variables.name: L2TV1-MIB::l2tTunnelType

description: The length of time the tunnel has been active in
hundredths of seconds.
variables.name: L2TV1-MIB::l2tTunnelUpTime

description: This TRAP is generated when a Layer-2 Tunnel
is NOT created due to an authentication failure.

event.Summary: Layer-2 Tunnel is NOT created due to an authentication failure

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD L2TV1-MIB::l2tAuthFailTunnel L2TV1-MIB::l2tAuthFailTunnelHostName s EXAMPLE L2TV1-MIB::l2tAuthFailTunnelIpAddress a 192.0.2.1

description: The host name used on the failed tunnel
authentication attempt.
variables.name: L2TV1-MIB::l2tAuthFailTunnelHostName

description: The IP address associated with the failed
tunnel authentication attempt.
variables.name: L2TV1-MIB::l2tAuthFailTunnelIpAddress

description: This TRAP is generated when a Session for a
Layer-2 Tunnel is NOT created due to an
authentication failure.

event.Summary: Session for a Layer-2 Tunnel is NOT created due to an authentication failure

description: The user name used on the failed
authentication attempt.
variables.name: L2TV1-MIB::l2tAuthFailUserId
